description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.
name: cLitterAbove
title: Carbon Mass in Above-Ground Litter
